About Me

"Don't let the world change your smile, but let your smile change the world"

Hello there! I'm Michael Ah and I'd like to thank you for browsing my website. If you don't know me, I am a passionate and joyful person by nature. I come from a small african island called Mauritius, thus I speak fluent French, Creole and English. I am a practicising Christian, and I am a strong believer that we make this world a better place by showing kindness regardless of our internal and external struggles. My hobbies consist of coding, hiking and watching/playing soccer. If I'm not at my desk answering your emails, you'll have to come find me in the mountains!

I am currently employed at Hexagon Autonomy & positioning as an R&D Engineering Intern. I have industry experience in software development, research and working on agile teams. On the side, I am an investor with experience day trading. My long term portfolios are into dividends and technological stocks (bullish).

My favorite sitcoms are Brooklyn99, How I met your mother and Big Bang theory (Sorry Office lovers). Unfortunately, if you don't listen to Avril Lavigne, I don't think we can be good friends.

Academic Aspiration

"If you always worry about today, you'll never enjoy tomorrow"

I am a 4th year Geomatics Engineering student at the University of Calgary with a long list of success and awards under my name. I registered in the department of geomatics engineering because of my interest in lidar data, GNSS (Global Navigation satelite systems) positioning and autonomous driving. In the future I would like to get involved in autonomy and deep learning.

I plan on going to a master’s in software engineering at the University of Calgary then proceed to another graduate program in applied computer science at the University of Dalhousie (Halifax). They have a strong program in mobile computing, data management and machine learning.

Volunteerism

"If not me, who? If not now, when?

In recent years, I’ve been an active leader in my community by mentoring my peers, volunteering at my local church and partaking in various charities. All of my commitments were done while still excelling in my academic.

I volunteer at my local church on weekends and help organize events at school with the geomatics engineering society as their vice president. I occasionally volunteer at the drop-in center, the mustard seed and at “feed the hungry” events!

In the past, I have been involved with Fuse Collective in helping design a shelter for twin view community garden. Fuse collective is an engineering and design club that creates, designs and participates in real initiatives with real-world impact. Right now, I am mentoring two engineering students through the Seymour Schulich Scholars program.

National Geomatics Engineering Competition

"The death rate for people who play it safe and for people who live bodly is the same, 100%"

"The National Geomatics Competition (NGC) is a student-led consulting engineering competition based in the field of Geomatics. Our focus is to bring together students and industry representatives from across the country. From the east to the west, NGC is now moving into Central Canada as the University of Waterloo hosts NGC 2020."

In 2020, I had the priviledge of representing the University of Calgary at the National Geomatics Engineering Competition (hosted in Waterloo).This iteration's problem was finding efficient and novel ways of improving and design an LRT station in the City of Guelp. My team and I strove hard making it to the final rounds before eventually losing to the University of New Brunswick and Universite Laval. It was of utmost honor to represent my engineering faculty and bring home the bronze medal.
